props.children:
# Kubernetes Jobs

You can also use a Job to run multiple Pods in parallel. A Job creates one or more Pods and ensures that a specified number of them successfully terminate.

In this notebook, you will learn how to create a job to run multiple tasks in parallel and use Kui's sequence diagram to inspect jobs and pods.

# Kubernetes Jobs

You can also use a Job to run multiple Pods in parallel. A Job creates one or more Pods and ensures that a specified number of them successfully terminate.

In this notebook, you will learn how to create a job to run multiple tasks in parallel and use Kui's sequence diagram to inspect jobs and pods.

# Jobs Completions And Parallelism

Jobs use completion and parallelism parameters to control the patterns to arrange pods to work on different things. In the example on the right, we specified the `completion` parameter to `20` and `parallelism` paramter to `4`. The job will start spawning pods till `20` pods are spawned, and each `4` of them can be run in parallel.

# Jobs Completions And Parallelism

Jobs use completion and parallelism parameters to control the patterns to arrange pods to work on different things. In the example on the right, we specified the `completion` parameter to `20` and `parallelism` paramter to `4`. The job will start spawning pods till `20` pods are spawned, and each `4` of them can be run in parallel.

completeEvent.command: kubectl get ns -n default kui-notebook-2 -o yaml

props.children: Now we can use `apply`, the following command applies `job.yaml` to the cluster and immediately starts displaying the `pods` and their status:
Now we can use `apply`, the following command applies `job.yaml` to the cluster and immediately starts displaying the `pods` and their status:

templates.data:
apiVersion: batch/v1
kind: Job
metadata:
  name: pi
spec:
  completions: 20
  parallelism: 4
  template:
    spec:
      containers:
      - name: pi
        image: perl
        command: ["perl",  "-Mbignum=bpi", "-wle", "print bpi(2000)"]
      restartPolicy: Never
  backoffLimit: 4

templates.data:
apiVersion: batch/v1
kind: Job
metadata:
  name: pi
spec:
  completions: 20
  parallelism: 4
  template:
    spec:
      containers:
      - name: pi
        image: perl
        command: ["perl",  "-Mbignum=bpi", "-wle", "print bpi(2000)"]
      restartPolicy: Never
  backoffLimit: 4

You can click the rows to inspect the `Pods`. 

You can also switch to a list or grid view by clicking the toolbar buttons at the bottom of the table.
